review_blob: I love it!  Just a great every day drinking Plae Ale from the best hoppy dudes around

Deep amber with a copper touch.  Good clean head with nice lacing and all thew fun of a IIPA with a touch of B-Wine.  Little bro of Hog Heaven is how I may describe it( a little).  I like it and would like to pour it all over my face so it stays with me for a while.

I was a bit disappointed from last years batch which I had at the brewery.  Nice colors, head , and aroma.  All to make it a wonderful experience like last year, but this seemed to be the Monster from last years little brother that hangs out with Commadore Perry too much!  Still a good beer, but at $10 for a 22oz. its a bit of a rip seeing that I can get the DreadNaught for less.  Should be no more then $6 per 22 OZ.  Bring back last years, please and knock off a few bucks GLBC!!!!!
beer_name: Great Lakes Lake Erie Monster Imperial IPA

review_blob: Hoppy Caramel goodness.  Well balanced with the high ABV and a light mouth to it.  High Five!!!!!
One of my favorite D IPAs.  Superhopped with massive citrus tones and wondeful lacing with a long lasting hop juice aoaking the buds.
beer_name: Avery The Maharaja Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: look out! This reminds me a of good Dreadnaught!!!  NOT!!!  Its bud, what do you expect.  Just a hot day, free, keg party kind of beer.
Exactly!  Dry is how to describe it.  Dry and poopy. I will just say enough of nothing to qualify for a rate
Bud with a skunk added to the bottle.  Can you believe these chumps charge $7-$8 for a six of this urine??????
A beer that should only be had when golfing, working in the hot sun or bathing because it is like water.  I will only drink it if it is free and or the only choice besides egg nog

poured a hazed goldy orange with a nice fluffy head.  very big beer in terms of feel, fruits and spices.  Lots going on and I like it and want more.  ABV is hiding in this one.  Lots of peeps recomend this and now I know why
dark, creamy nutty and spicy.  good, but not as good as the 05.  warming to the belly as the sipping goes on.  " Get in my Bewlly"
A very nice brew with a dark look.  Molasses and fruity and a pretty nice mouthfeel.  Suprised to pick it up at TJs, but happy.  Nice slow sipper

Had this at a tasting.  Went back for a couple more to see if I could get it straight.  Very nice aroma like a melon, plummy brown sugar-ish.  Color was a nice deep ruby/caramel.  sweet on taste and like others say, more of a desert beer.

I have had this brew many times, but failed to write about it for some reason.  It is not due to lack of a good brew for sure.  I really think this is a good beer and it os ranked up there on my D IPA list.  It has a nice look, the nose brings out the piney citrus hop feel and the taste does as well.  I wish it would be a bit thicker as I feel its a bit thin in feel.  My 101 Bottles in Kent, OH has a deal right now at $7.99 a six!!!! It is normally $12.99 a six.  I picked up a few and if I had the budget, I would have grabbed the remaining 5 cases at this price!!!  This beer is awesome, but at that price it becomes magical!!! It was in date, not od, no issues etc......  just some type of wicked deal!!!!!  Horray for me!

Pretty good beer.  Lots going on, maybe too much.  Sweet spiceyness, like jamaican BBQ(not the heat of course).  Molasses with some all spice noted malts?? is that right.  my guess.  seems to be a porter to me.

Pale Ale light explains it best for me.  Just of hint being a pale ale and compared to Two Hearted and Hopslam, its like a miller lite.  I would still drink it over typical venue beers(ie: bud, lite, coors etc...)

One of my favorite non double/triple/imperial IPAs.  Clipper City Loose Cannon has been my go to everyday drink all night IPA aside from Alpha King, Belles etc..., but this takes the cake.  I am with my other OHIO bro on here from West Chester, It has all the right notes a good IPA should have and better.  It is a bad ass brew!!!!!!!

I really like this brewer so far.  Not as sweet as one would think based on the name and aroma.  I was waiting for a molasses explosion, but it wasnt there.    Good amount of hops for a b wine.  I like hops!  ABV is nicley covered and not overpowering for a 10% er.

I have always loved this beer.  I have just been so addicted to HOPS as of late that I have not even thought about rating this gem until today when I make it a point to have a few on Pattys Day.  So many different varietys, can draught, bottle draught, extra stout bottle, tap etc....  The best is to have a real pint from a bar that knows what the hell they are doing when hooking it up and pouring and glassware.  You know you are at a pub/bar/joint etc... when they serve it in the right glass, room temp(NOT COLD)!!!! and it takes a few mintues to get your beer.  Add in the mix of correct NO2 and all the other jazz and viola!  Brilliant!!!!  Love the coffee, malty, chocolate tatses and the great appearance of this fine brew.  Love to watch the head cascade down the pint!!  Always a winner!!!

Great second level IPA.   I would suggest this to my friends who think Sierra Nevada is a BIG BEER!  This is the next level to get to true IPAs with some bite.  I have a friend in mind who I am going to bring to this level and oln to Dreadnaught we go......................

Damn good beer.  Its all there for a DIPA.  I thought the alcoho; was a bit too much at first, but as I had more it turned out I was wrong and it is hidden very well.  Big beer for big fun and just nice to sit and enjoy a good long brew!!  I think this batch was better then any Wild Dog I have had.
beer_name: Flying Dog Double Dog Double Pale Ale

review_blob: Good beer.  Just real lite on the typical IPA notes of citrus, piney, bitter.  Ill take it anyday over your typical brews(bud, coors etc...)

It is better then breakfast with the Pope!  Dark and dangerous!!   This is a wonderful stout full of the best a breakfast stout can offer.  Coffee, Malt, cocao oatmeal, scrambled eggs, homefries with tabasco etc.........  Its all ther!!  Just kidding, only the godd stouty things dreams are made of

DeuceDeuceOU must be high in Athens!  Not to argue on this wonderful site, but to compare this beer to Dreadnaught????!!!!!  You must be crazy and kicked off the site!!!!  This beer is good and i am glad to say it is in my hometown, but it is a Kia compared to Dreadnaughts Lamorghini bro!!!!  It has a nice mild hoppiness to it and is clean and crisp with the usual citrus aroma/taste.  Overpriced as it should be $7/$8 tops a six pack.  Not $4/5 for a 22oz!!!
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Hoppin to Heaven IPA

review_blob: I am not a big Tripel guy, but I was in love with this berr when I first had it.  Nice spice and ABV levels.  Great appearance.  I saw some guy say that once it went past his labia, he could have danced all night.  Well if that dude has a labia, he shouldnt have a wife cause he if one.  Get a thesaurus bro?!?!  It wasnt good enough to turn me into a woman!!

I smell victory.  They make good beer.  Nice aroma, sweet and gooey.  Good lacing in the glass and good alcohol covering.  Dont realize the strength until you stand up afetr a few.  Nice touch of hops and I will have more some day for sure, if I can pull myself away from IPAs
I like the Original BO Stout Better.  Simple as that!  A bit too much boubron for me but still better than most stout out there.  I am confused (or drunk).

Low on hops.  Was excited reading that it was Cascade hops, but maybe 1/8 hop nugget per batch.  More of an English(Euro) pale ale as in much heavier on the malt side then hops.  Very sad that I picked this over my everyday excellent Loose Cannon, but I had to try a new one and now I know never to buy it again unless itss the last beer on earth.
Great beer!  Kind of a creamy IPA.  It has a hoppy aroma and I will take that anyday!
A nice drinkable IPA.  Not to overbearing with anything.  Nice easy aroma of citrus, maybe some pine.  Nice and crisp, will drink again for sure.

Afew 22 oz. bottles.  Nice beer indeed!  A bit nicer then their double IPA which I happen to think is one of the better bangs for your buck and this one is as well.  Nice ABV % , but you cant tell its that high and of course it has a nice citrus aroma and a good balance of carbo, malts, etc...
beer_name: Moylans Hopsickle Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: UPDATED: MAR 20, 2007
Sweet bottle!  A bit too expensive seeing that I could get Dreadnaught for $4-5.00 less a bottle.  Nice intense hoppiness, heavy citrus.  Pine taste as well.  Overall a very nice brew.
beer_name: Rogue XS Imperial India Pale Ale (IPA)

review_blob: A good dub IPA.  Cloudy orange in color with a light head that leaves quickly.  Has orange flavor as it hits the buds and then seems to finish with a nice malty end.  Not as hoppy as Id like.
I happen to love this beer!  Great lite dark brew with some very lite tones of cocoa/malty caramel.  Toasty as well.  Also gives you some wicked beer farts the next day to piss off your wife!!!!!
Great for low crabs and for mass consumption!  Thats about it.  Just a decent party beer and Ill drink it if I have no choice.

Great name!!!  I was loving this brew when I first tried it, but as I got into tasting a bit more, I realized it was too sweet.  I like sweet every now and then, but this just goes too far for me.  I like to be able to drink at least 3-4 of a beer, but this is a 1-2 er.  Great color and taste, but only for a bit then Im in need of HOPS!!!!!!!

erry X-MAs!   Great spices and the perfect amoutn give this brew a nod as one of the better holiday brews out ther.  Spicey, hoppy, warm and coy!  Makes me want to give people gifts!!!  Great dark amber in colorand all is good once it hits those lips!

Another great Great lakes brew!!!!!  These guys are good!!!  Great Pale Ale to sit and enjoy.  Not too strong and just the right amount of hoppiness fused with good citrus pop.  Great cloudy amber color and it is just a great stand by APA if nothing else is jumping at ya.. Cant go wrong wth this brew.
beer_name: Great Lakes Burning River Pale Ale

review_blob: I blacked out, what do I know!!!  Just kidding!  Great Stout.  Lots of sweet dark chocolate and cocoa buds and it warms me up a bit.  Beautiful dark colorand taste. Maybe more towards a heavy porter then stout.

Hometown brew!  Great lakes kicks ass!  This one is real sweet and birthday cake like as the label shows.  Cloves, jamaican suger(demerara), creamy honey and it hides the alchy well.  Some hops pop out, but it is an brew that should be enjoyed maybe one or two throughout the night(or day as long as its noon somewhere)!!!!

I was let down with this beer.  2004 vintage.  Definitely has the dark frutiy flavors coming though.  Like berrand rugby said, plums, raisons, malt/caramel.  A great beer, but I expected more.  I could taste the alchy more then I hoped for.  Call me a bastard for not raving about it, but it is a good beer that I was just hoping for more out of.

Kills Avery "10".  Masks the alcohol contane well, very fruity, hoppy malty and make me happy.  Got some nice hints of pine as well as chewy malts.  A very nice and delish brew ha ha.. Not much else to say but get some.

A clear amberish color.  Very light head.  A very strong citrus pop at first then i mlty and alcoholly all the way.. The Alcohol isn;t masked very well in my opinion. Very fruity aroma.  Aftertaste lingers a while.   "11" is much better!

Dark and chocolate in color with a very light head that doesnt stick around long.  As I opened the bottle and took a whiff, the very strong smell of chocolate hops burst out of the bottle.  roasted marshmellow malty flavor with a very clean and crisp finish.  Another good one from Founders
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2007

One of the best Ive had recently.  Lives up to the hype.  Thsi beer is very hoppy and has the ability to make the drinker of it jones for more.  Earthy notes of flavor and the yeast is definitely there.  AWESOME!!!

Local brew for me.  Had both on tap and bottle.  Not the strongest IPA around but it is good with slight citrus and malty flavors.  Poured real nice and left some sporadic lacing.  I like this beer beter from the bottle.  I will be making some of my own soon but will add a 90 minute to the task!
Wicked Brew!  Cant wait to try the 120 if I can get it.   Great hops and a bit of citrus in there.  Love to drink it nice and slow!
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2007
